title: Kindersley Logo Critique
content:
I’m doing a logo for the town of Kindersley and I would love some comments & critique on my logo.

Requirements:

- Same color blue
- Discover Kindersley name in that order
- A goose must be included

Look forward to your input

 [‹ hand-drawn logos, your opinion](http://web.archive.org/web/20081122065724/http:/www.typophile.com/node/48009 "Go to previous forum topic") [Health products company ›](http://web.archive.org/web/20081122065724/http:/www.typophile.com/node/48753 "Go to next forum topic")
author: christopher.martens

comments.content:
Darn, forgot to add the image, my apologies. Here is the link...

[http://freshnewthing.com/kindersley\_logo.jpg](http://web.archive.org/web/20081122065724/http:/freshnewthing.com/kindersley_logo.jpg "http://freshnewthing.com/kindersley\_logo.jpg")

I like the goose and the colors you’ve chosen. I think there are a few changes that need to be made to the type though.

Is the “.com” necessary? - This is for a town isn’t it?

I wouldn’t do the glassy effect on the type as it’s been done to death and I don’t think it suits a logo for a town - to me it suggests a more programming/internet type company.

The contemporary style sans-serif font along with the effect you have on it AND the “.com” give this a very modern, cold feel. It’s too corporate. I’d suggest removing the reflection effect, removing the “.com” and perhaps changing the font to one with a little more character. (though the font selection may be fine once the glassy effect is removed).

penn

The “.com” was also a requirement in both of the logos. The logo is actually for a city website which I forgetfully neglected to mention. I think I might agree with taking away the gloss. I’ll make some revisions and play around with some fonts.

Your design is nicely done but I agree with pennANDink. in it’s current state your logo looks very slick and corporate. Why the goose? Is it the town symbol/mascot? With a goose I think of a northern mountain town with a lake, lots of fishing, hiking, boating, nature preserves etc. What is the town really like? Your contemporary sans doesn’t seem like an appropriate choice.

btw, I also like your Rosetown logo design.

I think this is well executed but perhaps you could supply us with more information. Where is the city located? Why does the goose need to be included? Why such a corporate colour palette? Why such a punchy sans serif? I think more information is required before we can judge whether this is a good or bad design.

Hi Christopher,

very good start. Is that gradient on the letters really necessary though? It might look better without. I have seen a very similar goose somewhere else on this forum before. Let me see if I can find it...

Yep, here it is:

 ![](http://web.archive.org/web/20081122065724im_/http:/www.typophile.com/files/35305_4737.gif)

[Webdesign Hamburg](http://web.archive.org/web/20081122065724/http:/www.designbits.de/)

Oops, file was larger than I expected. Apologies...

[Webdesign Hamburg](http://web.archive.org/web/20081122065724/http:/www.designbits.de/)
But Timo, this is clearly the rare eagle-duck. ;)

If nothing else, you will have to correct kerning.

BTW: Since it’s a mark for a town, did you think to use some kind of heraldry in it? Not in a regular old fashioned way but an open modern way? It will definitely put it apart from corporate identity.

I’d also make a different stylisation of the goose...  
\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_  
_Robert Koritnik_
